intro: Alsodeia flavescens, commonly known as the yellow alsike, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Alsodeia flavescens is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
